user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space:
```c
static void
handle_req_chunk_size_line_no_space (struct MHD_Connection *c,
                                     const char *chunk_size_line,
                                     size_t chunk_size_line_size)
{
  unsigned int err_code;

  if (NULL != chunk_size_line)
  {
    const char *semicol;
    /* Check for chunk extension */
    semicol = memchr (chunk_size_line, ';', chunk_size_line_size);
    if (NULL != semicol)
    { /* Chunk extension present. It could be removed without any loss of the
         details of the request. */
      transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                      MHD_HTTP_CONTENT_TOO_LARGE,
                                      ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_EXT_TOO_BIG);
    }
  }
  err_code = get_no_space_err_status_code (c,
                                           MHD_PROC_RECV_BODY_CHUNKED,
                                           chunk_size_line,
                                           chunk_size_line_size);
  transmit_error_response_static (c,
                                  err_code,
                                  ERR_MSG_REQUEST_CHUNK_LINE_TOO_BIG);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No function parameter is modified in this function. Specifically:
- chunk_size_line is declared as const char * and is only read (passed to memchr and to get_no_space_err_status_code); it is never assigned to or otherwise changed within this function.
- chunk_size_line_size is a value parameter (size_t) and is only read; it is not assigned to or altered.
- c (struct MHD_Connection *) is only passed as an argument to other functions; the pointer variable itself is not reassigned or modified.
- semicol is a local pointer (const char *) receiving the result of memchr; that is a local variable, not a parameter.
Because there are no assignments, increments, or reassignments of the parameter variables in this code fragment, there are no places that violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 within the provided function body.
